DataElement.preferredName: Patient Or Guardian Consent Comprehension Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether a patient or their guardian/legal representative comprehend and are able to sign a written consent document.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research._Permission to do something._An ability to understand the meaning or importance of something (or the knowledge acquired as a result).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An individual who is authorized under applicable State or local law to consent on behalf of a child or incapable person to general medical care including participation in clinical research.

Property.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:An ability to understand the meaning or importance of something (or the knowledge acquired as a result).

Concepts.definition: An ability to understand the meaning or importance of something (or the knowledge acquired as a result).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient or Legally Authori
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient or Legally Authorized Representative (LAR) able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient or legal guardian (if patient is less than 18 years old) able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient, or Legally Authorized Representative (LAR) of patient with Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC), able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has impaired decision making capacity, do they have a Legal Authorized representative or caretaker available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient or a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR) able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or patients with Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) if they are represented by a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or patients with impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) who have a close caregiver or legal guardian, if they have consent of the caregiver/guardian?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or patients with Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) if they are represented by a Legally Authorized Representative (e.g., spouse, adult child, live-in caretaker)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or patients with impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) who have a close caregiver or legal guardian, if they have consent of the caregiver/guardian?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC), do they have a legal guardian or a close family member available to assist them?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theraex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or patients with Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) if they are represented by a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR) ) and/or family member?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document, and for patients with impaired decision making capacity, is the consent of a close legal guardian readily available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document, and for patients with impaired decision making capacity, is the consent of the legally authorized representative or caregiver available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient with Impaired Decision Making capacity (IDMC) have a caregiver or Legally Authorized Representative (LAR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or if patient has Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC), does patient have a close caregiver or a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR) available to assist them?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or if patient has Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC) does patient have a close caregiver or a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR), provided that the treating Physician is reasonably sure that the possible risks and benefits of the study are clear and that the patient will take the drug as prescribed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or does participant with impaired decision making capacity (IDMC) have a legally authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient with impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC) have a legally authorized representative (LAR) or caregiver available to assist them?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent document or if the patient has Impaired Decision making Capacity, does the patient have a close relative, guardian, caregiver or Legally Authorized Representative to provide consent on their behalf?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient or legally authorized representative, if applicable, able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or if patient has Impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC), does patient have a close caregiver or a Legally Authorized Representative (LAR)  and/or family member available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document (or parent or legally authorized representative, if minor), and for  patients with impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC), does patient  have consent from a legally-authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document (or parent or legally authorized representative, if minor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document and for patients with impaired Decision Making Capacity (IDMC), does patient have consent from a legally-authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document, and for patients with impaired decision making capacity, is the consent of the legally authorized representative or caregiver available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or does participant with impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC) have a legally authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient and/or their parents or legally authorized representatives able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent (Assent, where appropriate, will be obtained according to local policy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient and/or their parent or legally authorized representatives able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or if it is a participant with impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC) is a legally authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document or does patient with impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC) have a legally-authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: For patients less than 18 years of age: Is the patient or their LAR (i.e, parent or legal guardian) able to give informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient and/or their parents or legally authorized representatives able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and willing to sign a written informed consent document or does participant with impaired decision-making capacity (IDMC) have a legally authorized representative (LAR) and/or family member available?
